{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3409062,"name":"Issac Woo","username":"Issacboy123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/issacboy123/{size}/232932_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T19:24:11.924Z","cooked":"

Hello CD gang,
After our robot has been turned on for a while, all vision systems get noticeably more laggier. Latency becomes extremely unreasonable (to like 3 seconds) and the framerate is also very poor, worse than regular settings. However, any information from the coprocessors is still updated at a reasonable rate. We are using static IP addressing, which didn’t help much. For some reason, after we redeploy code, the vision systems become normal again. Of course, as I had said earlier, turning the robot off and on again fixes the issue… for a little while until it becomes laggy. However, when we restart the roboRIO, the lag persists. Are we doing anything wrong? Or is this a problem with our setup, networking, hardware? Might we be pushing our hardware too much?

Here is our robot configuration (I’m probably missing some important details.):
Limelight 2 → 10.72.45.11-> streaming at 320x240, and the frame rate is around 12 normally.
Photonvision on an Orange Pi 5 → 10.72.45.12 → Processing at 1280x720 30fps, Streaming at 213x120
Microsoft USB Lifecam-3000 connected onto roboRio
roboRio 1 → 10.72.45.2
openMesh radio → 10.72.45.1

Edit: Added some extra info
Edit: Here are some videos of the problems: https://youtu.be/2pty80oB994
and https://youtu.be/MGXQ07dcXkU

What are you streaming to? What is your CPU usage? Also is the robot lagging or just vision systems?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T19:52:55.010Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":244,"readers_count":243,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468799,"topic_slug":"the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is","display_username":"David B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"David, Mentor FRC 6004/4795"},"post_url":"/t/the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is/468799/2","custom_user_title":"David, Mentor FRC 6004/4795","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3409082,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T19:59:34.526Z","cooked":"

So, to clarify, you’re using 3 different vision solutions on your robot at once?
Limelight 2, PhotonVision/OrangePi, AND a Lifecam through the RoboRIO 1?

I am not a programmer, but a few things I would check (just as far as general troubleshooting)…

  1. Disconnect one of the 3 vision systems and see if the lag still happens with the other two connected. Repeat for each system and see if you can isolate the cause. (Note that if the lag is cumulative across all connected systems, it may take longer for issues to present when only 2/3 are connected, so test longer than you would otherwise).
  2. Check your DS logs, check CPU/RAM utilization on the RIO, etc.
  3. Check to make sure it’s the robot lagging and not your DS laptop, check Task Manager, etc (David_IsMe beat me to this one)

Also, for streaming the cameras, are you just opening browser windows to connect to them, or a custom dashboard? Does being tethered vs running wireless make any difference?

Normally, if it was just the video stream to the laptop I would automatically assume the issue was either the laptop or maybe your Radio. That said, we’ve had all kinds of issues with USB cameras connected directly to the RIO, and we’ve generally avoided using RIO-connected cameras because of that, so there might be something going on there too.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T20:01:39.868Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":82.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468799,"topic_slug":"the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is/468799/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3409146,"name":"Issac Woo","username":"Issacboy123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/issacboy123/{size}/232932_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T22:19:31.954Z","cooked":"

We’re streaming to Shuffle board, but we notice the same lag whether we’re on shuffleboard or browser. In our observations, it is just the vision systems that are lagging, the robot isn’t lagging.

I’ll check CPU usage in our meeting tomorrow, but I didn’t notice anything peculiar about the performance of the rest of the computer.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T22:19:31.954Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468799,"topic_slug":"the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is","display_username":"Issac Woo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":39555,"username":"David_IsMe","name":"David B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/david_isme/{size}/196853_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64870,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum of 7245 - Team Captain"},"post_url":"/t/the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is/468799/4","custom_user_title":"Alum of 7245 - Team Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3409147,"name":"Issac Woo","username":"Issacboy123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/issacboy123/{size}/232932_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T22:21:21.354Z","cooked":"

Yes, we’re using 3 different vision solutions. I’ll be able to check all of this data during our meeting tomorrow. We’ve only tested using wireless, but it’s probably a good idea for us to test tethered. We notice the lag on both shuffleboard and when viewing on the browser.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T22:21:21.354Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":30.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468799,"topic_slug":"the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is","display_username":"Issac Woo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64870,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum of 7245 - Team Captain"},"post_url":"/t/the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is/468799/5","custom_user_title":"Alum of 7245 - Team Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3409221,"name":"YunYue Chen","username":"YueYue","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-18T07:52:41.124Z","cooked":"

I think this may have a lot to do with the size and type of data you send back. At the same time, does your team still communicate with robotrio in “Limelight” mode or NetworkTable mode?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-18T07:52:41.124Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468799,"topic_slug":"the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is","display_username":"YunYue Chen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49930,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is/468799/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3409231,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-18T10:01:45.922Z","cooked":"

@cbale2000 has excellent advice and follow that first.

If after following his advice you determine that it is vision check these things out.

Disconnect camera connected to RIO and comment out associated code. I think the most likely problem is you have a memory management issue with this.

Then if it is determined the that the custom rio vision isn’t the problem eliminate the other two one by one.

After you determine which vision system is the problem check the code. Try removing the code for the vision system leaving it connected and see if that solves the problem.

A couple of other outside contenders for the problem.
Heat the single board computers will throttle themselves down if they become hot.
Or a network switch could if used could be the problem either its firmware or heat.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-18T10:01:45.922Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":468799,"topic_slug":"the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/the-longer-the-robot-is-on-the-laggier-vision-is/468799/7","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3409331,"name":"Issac Woo","username":"Issacboy123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/issacboy123/{size}/232932_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-18T19:11:55.753Z","cooked":"

Hey all,
Just wanted to let you all know about our preliminary findings.
First off, we believe that the operator laptop (driver station) isn’t the cause, as the CPU usage never exceeds 30% when using the robot.

The connection method might be an issue. When we connected via ethernet, we noticed that the vision was fine. For some reason, when we were testing via wifi (usual method), this time, it took a long time before we noticed any significant slow downs. But after we actually started driving around (outside), the slowdowns became apparent.

So, following @cbale2000’s advice, we disconnected the lifecam first. The slowdown was noticeably a bit better, but we relied on the lifecam for driver vision, so we tried disconnecting photonvision, which we used a lot less. In our main code, we aren’t using photonvision anyways, but in our test code, there always is a large slowdown after a short while when using photonvision. Anyways, after disconnecting photonvision, the vision was usable.

I’ve also attached a picture of the system information from the roboRIO dashboard.

IMG_76711920×2560 550 KB

I do want to add, it is hotter where we’re testing (outside), so it might be a good consideration that perhaps our coprocessors and roborio is getting hotter, so they’re throttling themselves. Our driver station, though very hot to the touch, is still doing fine though, and we have good reason to believe that it isn’t the culprit for our issues, since either way, the vision lags inside as well, though a bit less.

Our network switch is a way older model, and max is at 100Mbit, so that might be an issue, though I believe that it wouldn’t be an issue since it works fine for a little while.

For now, we’ll probably disconnect photonvision in competition (Sunset showdown this weekend!), but might there be any solutions for why photonvision causes these significant slowdowns in vision?
